pr_title: Allow to define part of the Hibernate ORM config at runtime

timeline.bodyText: I'd love to understand the need for this better. Could you elaborate, and maybe evolve the comments for future reference?
timeline.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText:
This is something we shouldn't access during the static init phase as it's only used when creating the entity manager factory.
Thus, to be extra sure we don't access it, I decided to make it extra safe by throwing exceptions.
We now define the PersistenceProviderResolver twice: once at the beginning of the static init phase with this one, which shouldn't be used and the second time at the beginning of the runtime phase where we also push the runtime properties.
BTW, it was more or less done this way before i.e. I haven't changed anything really, just made it clearer. Mostly because I now need to push the runtime properties in the constructor. I could have define a setter and rely on the order of operations but I prefer having things immutable and fully constructed.
replies.author: gsmet

timeline.message:
Provide better DCE information when Agroal is not around

When Agroal is not around, we should never delegate to the JDBC-based
PersistenceProvider as things will fail, given we don't have a JDBC
datasource around.

Obviously, the test we introduce is not sufficient as having Agroal
around is not enough to have a proper Hibernate ORM setup but that's the
best we can do and should be sufficient in most cases.
